OverviewTHE ROLE: Herbalife Nutrition is standing up our Digital Office to prioritize, lead and complete an enterprise-wide digital transformation. In this newly built position, the Sr Director Digital Data & Analytics will lead the practice for the Digital Office focusing on four key areas: Strategy, Data driven experience, Web Analytics, and Insights/Reporting. This is a leadership role responsible to lead the people and teams that ideate and deliver a data and analytics roadmap across the integrated lifecycle: collection, synthesis, insight, and application, with the goal of driving business growth. The position will be accountable for building and leading a successful team and helping achieve annual revenue targets and success metrics. The role will be stationed at the corporate headquarters but will work across 95 global markets, partnering with Global Technology Services, Marketing, Sales, Member Support and regional leadership to ensure consistent and efficient execution of the analytics strategy.HOW YOU WOULD CONTRIBUTE: Create and own Herbalife’s digital data & analytics strategy, in alignment with Herbalife’s overall business and digital strategyLead analysis and provide deep insights into the Distributor and Customer digital experience; synthesize usage patterns, difficulties, and product gaps to advise Product Development teamBuild an ambitious vision for the potential for data, AI, ML to power customer and distributor, predictive and prescriptive engagement, and be responsible for the successful implementation of this vision in partnership with technology teams Remain highly aware of the external market, customer expectations and outstanding technology solutions; partner with product and technology on recommendations where to build vs buy capabilitiesDevelop and communicate executive level presentations that articulate our value driven approach to product development and support team member organizational changeCollaborate with Consumer Insights to develop surveys, NPS etc. for new digital products/journey’s and to ensure results are accounted for in continuous improvement cyclePartner with Sales Strategy and Global Technology teams to define integration of Web Analytics and reporting in global BI programs enhancing the efficiency of data across the organizationSupport product and regional teams in structuring and analyzing performance of A/B tests and pilot’sInterface frequently with regional analytics leads to ensure successful implementation and adaptation of analytics strategy in regional COE’sSupport the Digital Office to scale with a focus on building an impactful Data Analytics teamResponsible for leading all aspects of 3rd party digital data technologies and associated budgetsWHAT’S SPECIAL ABOUT THE TEAM: We are entrepreneurs serving entrepreneurs, digital enthusiasts, agile, passionate about value, always flexible and continuously improving.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Supervises 3-4 direct reports; Team structure and size to be further defined as this is a new departmentQualificationsSKILLS AND BACKGROUND REQUIRED TO BE SUCCESSFUL: 12+ years’ experience in Data Analytics in consumer or technology sectorsExperience in a leadership role in a large global enterprise with proven track record to communicate optimally and influence cross functional teamsStrong understanding of customer needs and competition to ensure differentiated success of data driven product portfolioInnovation-driven attitude with a passion for process improvement, digital transformation, and new technologiesDemonstrable track record of using artificial intelligence and machine learning to deliver significant business benefitsInspiring and highly capable leader with the ability to establish clear strategy that can motivate others to deliver, and influence change across the organizationAbility to interact effectively with individuals from different countries and cultures, with a sensitivity to cultural diversityFamiliarity with industry and regulatory standard methodologies for data collection and use occasional travel EducationBachelor’s degree in data, analytics, computer science, or equivalentAt Herbalife, we value doing what’s right. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected characteristic. We value diversity, strive for inclusivity, and believe the differences among our teammates is a key contributor to Herbalife’s ongoing success.Herbalife offers a variety of benefits to eligible employees in the U.S. (limited to the 50 States and the District of Columbia), which includes Group Health Programs, other Voluntary Benefit Programs, and Paid Time Off. Group Health Programs include Medical, Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA), Basic Life/AD&D; Short-Term and Long-Term Disability and an Employee Assistance Program (EAP).Other Voluntary Benefit Programs include a 401(k) plan, Wellness Incentive Program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), Supplemental Life/Critical Illness/Hospitalization/Accident Insurance, and Pet Insurance. Paid time off includes Company-observed U.S. Holidays, Floating Holidays, Vacation, Sick Time, a Volunteer Program, Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave, Bereavement Leave, Personal Leave and time off for voting.Hiring Range: 235,000.00 to 266,000.00 USD Annually
